data.title: Casey McQuiston [Archive of Our Own]
data.meta_description:
An Archive of Our Own, a project of the
    Organization for Transformative Works
data.text:
The buzz of chatter and clinking glasses filled the dimly lit room as guests swirled through the space in a dizzying array of costumes. It was a costume party like no other, hosted by a local geek community at a popular downtown venue. The theme was “Galactic Legends,” and the decorations were a vibrant mix of stars, planets, and iconic space ships.

Alex Claremont-Diaz pushed through the crowd, his Han Solo outfit as smooth as he’d hoped. The black vest and white shirt fit perfectly, and the blaster holster strapped to his hip completed the look. He’d meticulously crafted his costume over weeks, determined to embody the charming smuggler with every detail.

He adjusted his blaster one last time and scanned the room. The sight of so many fellow fans dressed as their favorite characters was exhilarating. The party was just getting started, and the atmosphere buzzed with excitement.

As he made his way to the bar, Alex’s attention was drawn to a figure across the room. The man stood tall and proud, dressed in an elaborate male Leia costume—golden braids, flowing white gown, and even a replica blaster strapped to his side. His attire was impressively accurate, though the sheer audacity of a male Leia made it stand out even more.

Alex found himself grinning, unable to resist the urge to approach. The man in the Leia costume had his back turned, and Alex made his way through the crowd with a purposeful stride. He tapped him on the shoulder, trying to suppress his amusement.

“Excuse me,” Alex said as the man turned around. “I’ve got to say, I’ve seen a lot of Leia costumes tonight, but this one is… quite unique.”

The man blinked in surprise, his eyes meeting Alex’s with a mix of curiosity and amusement. “Oh really? And how’s that?” He gave a small, playful smirk.

“Well,” Alex began, taking in the intricate details of the costume, “for one, Leia’s never looked quite so dashing in a white gown.”

The man laughed, a melodious sound that made Alex’s heart skip a beat. “I’m flattered. I suppose it’s not every day you see a male Leia.”

“True,” Alex said, his eyes twinkling with mischief. “Though I have to admit, seeing you in this outfit makes me wonder if Han Solo would be jealous.”

“Jealous?” The man raised an eyebrow, clearly intrigued. “Of what exactly?”

“Of the attention you’re getting,” Alex said, leaning in slightly. “It’s not often you see Leia herself—well, him—drawing all the eyes.”

The man chuckled and gave a slight bow. “I do aim to please. And I have to say, Han Solo looks rather impressive tonight as well. Though, I’m curious—how does it feel to be such a charming rogue?”

Alex grinned. “Well, it’s all about the swagger. And the blaster. And the witty comebacks, of course.”

The man’s eyes sparkled with amusement. “Witty comebacks, huh? Do you have any examples for me?”

Alex put a hand on his hip, striking a pose. “Sure, but you’ll have to promise not to be too impressed. You know, Han Solo style.”

“I’ll try to contain my excitement,” the man replied with a teasing tone.

“Alright, how about this?” Alex said, adopting a mock-serious expression. “Did you know that in the galaxy, there are two things you can always count on? One, that Han Solo will always find a way to escape danger. And two, that Leia will always save the day.”

The man’s laughter was genuine and full. “I suppose I’ll have to agree with that. But isn’t there a third thing? That a certain scoundrel will always find a way to flirt with anyone in sight?”

Alex’s grin widened. “You’ve got me there. Though I like to think of it as spreading charm rather than just flirting.”

“Spreading charm, you say?” The man leaned closer, lowering his voice to a conspiratorial whisper. “And here I thought you were just trying to impress me.”

Alex’s breath hitched slightly at the closeness. He met the man’s gaze and felt an undeniable spark. “Well, you caught me. Maybe a little bit of both.”

They stood there for a moment, the buzz of the party fading into the background as they exchanged glances. The connection was instant and electric, making Alex feel as though they were the only two people in the room.

“So,” the man said softly, breaking the silence, “what’s your name, Han Solo?”

“Alex,” he replied, unable to hide the warmth in his voice. “And you?”

“Henry,” the man said with a smile. “Nice to meet you, Alex.”

“Nice to meet you too, Henry,” Alex said, savoring the sound of the name. “Do you come to these parties often?”

Henry shook his head. “Not really. This is actually my first time. I’m more of a low-key fan, but this seemed like too much fun to pass up.”

“Well, I’m glad you did,” Alex said, taking a step closer. “It’s not every day you meet someone who makes the galaxy feel a little more exciting.”

Henry’s eyes softened, and he seemed to consider Alex’s words carefully. “And I’m glad I ran into you. Seems like the Force was with me tonight.”

Alex chuckled, feeling a rush of affection.

“So, tell me, Henry—how do you feel about the idea of a Han Solo and Leia team-up?”

Henry raised an eyebrow, clearly intrigued. “Are we talking about a costume team-up, or something more... adventurous?”

Alex’s grin widened. “I’m open to suggestions. But I have to say, I’m partial to the idea of both.”

Henry’s eyes sparkled with amusement. “Well, I suppose we could make this an epic collaboration. But only if you promise not to steal all the attention with that blaster of yours.”

“Steal all the attention?” Alex said with mock innocence. “I’m just here to make friends and share some intergalactic charm.”

Henry’s smile was soft and inviting. “In that case, consider me intrigued.”

As they continued to chat, the conversation flowed effortlessly. They swapped stories about their favorite films, debated over the best Star Wars moments, and shared their thoughts on the newest geeky shows and games. The connection between them grew stronger with each shared laugh and exchanged glance.

The party continued around them, but for Alex and Henry, it felt like the world had narrowed to just the two of them. The noise and activity seemed to fade into the background, leaving them in their own little bubble of warmth and camaraderie.

At one point, Alex noticed that Henry’s gaze lingered on him with a certain intensity. The playful banter had shifted into something deeper, a palpable sense of connection that Alex couldn’t ignore. The chemistry between them was undeniable, and Alex felt a flutter of anticipation in his chest.

As the night wore on, Alex found himself wanting to be closer to Henry. The way their conversations had turned into more personal revelations made Alex realize that he was genuinely attracted to him. The idea of making a move was tempting, but he wanted to be sure it was mutual.

“You know,” Alex said, leaning in a little closer, “there’s something about tonight that feels... special.”

Henry’s eyes met his, a soft smile playing on his lips. “I know what you mean. It’s like the stars have aligned perfectly.”

Alex’s heart raced as he felt a surge of courage. “Henry, I’ve really enjoyed spending time with you tonight. More than I expected.”

Henry’s gaze softened, and he took a small step closer. “I’ve enjoyed it too, Alex. It’s been... unexpectedly wonderful.”

There was a moment of silence, charged with the unspoken feelings that had been building between them. Alex took a deep breath and reached out, gently cupping Henry’s cheek.

“Can I...” Alex started, his voice barely above a whisper, “can I kiss you?”

Henry’s eyes flickered with a mix of surprise and affection. “I’d like that.”

With a shared understanding, Alex leaned in, closing the distance between them. Their lips met in a tender kiss, the warmth of the moment enveloping them. The kiss was gentle but filled with an undeniable connection, a perfect culmination of the evening’s flirtation and growing intimacy.

When they finally pulled away, both were breathless, their smiles reflecting the happiness they felt.

“So,” Henry said softly, his hand still resting on Alex’s arm, “where does this leave us in our epic space saga?”

Alex chuckled, his heart full. “I’d say it’s a promising start to a new adventure.”

Henry’s eyes sparkled with a mixture of affection and excitement. “I’m looking forward to it.”

They spent the rest of the evening together, their bond growing deeper with every shared moment. The party continued around them, but Alex and Henry were lost in their own world, discovering more about each other with every passing minute.

As the night drew to a close, Alex took Henry’s hand in his, feeling the warmth and strength in his grip. “Here’s to new adventures and unexpected connections.”

Henry squeezed his hand gently, his eyes filled with promise. “Here’s to that, and to whatever comes next.”
